prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

 When Stefan married Suzanne, he took her surname instead of her taking his. and following the civil ceremony, as required in Germany, when Stefan sent out invitations to his long-distance relatives, from his personal email, inviting them to the formal ceremony - the joint signature that he signed, he put her name first instead of his.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

 When Stefan married Suzanne, he took her surname instead of her taking his. and following the civil ceremony, as required in Germany, when Stefan sent out invitations to his long-distance relatives, from his personal email, inviting them to the formal ceremony - the joint signature that he signed, he put her name first instead of his.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What specifically is the deeply personal reason(s) and motivation(s) that led Stefan to voluntarily submit his identity to Suzanne when he married her, and why is it wounding him now?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a comprehensive list of the horary chart data relevant to your inquiry using traditional horary principles:

1. Chart Basics
 • Date/Time: Tuesday, February 4, 2025, at 10:47 AM
 • Location: South Lyon, Michigan, United States

2. Planetary Positions (Degrees and Signs)
 • Sun at 16° Aquarius
 • Moon at 7° Taurus
 • Mercury at 12° Aquarius
 • Venus at 0° Aries
 • Mars at 19° Cancer (retrograde)
 • Jupiter at 11° Gemini
 • Saturn at 17° Pisces
 • Uranus at 23° Taurus
 • Neptune at 28° Pisces
 • Pluto at 2° Aquarius
 • North Node at 29° Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron at 19° Aries

3. House Cusp Details
 • 1st House: starts at 1° Taurus      (Contains Moon and Uranus)
 • 2nd House: starts at 8° Gemini      (Contains Jupiter)
 • 3rd House: starts at 29° Gemini
 • 4th House: starts at 16° Cancer      (Contains Mars)
 • 5th House: starts at 6° Leo
 • 6th House: starts at 10° Virgo      (Stefan’s 9th House per cross-reference)
 • 7th House: starts at 1° Scorpio
 • 8th House: starts at 8° Sagittarius
 • 9th House: starts at 29° Sagittarius   (Stefan’s 12th House → given his representation)
 • 10th House: starts at 16° Capricorn   (Contains Pluto)
 • 11th House: starts at 6° Aquarius    (Contains Sun and Mercury)
 • 12th House: starts at 10° Pisces     (Contains Venus, Saturn, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron)

4. House Cross-Reference for Stefan
 Based on your provided guide (Stefan represented by the 9th house) and the chart’s houses:
  • Chart’s 6th House corresponds to Stefan’s 9th House.
  • Additionally, note other house conversions for context if required:
   – Chart’s 1st House = Stefan’s 4th House
   – Chart’s 2nd House = Stefan’s 5th House
   – Chart’s 3rd House = Stefan’s 6th House
   – Chart’s 4th House = Stefan’s 7th House
   – Chart’s 5th House = Stefan’s 8th House
   – Chart’s 7th House = Stefan’s 10th House
   – Chart’s 8th House = Stefan’s 11th House
   – Chart’s 9th House = Stefan’s 12th House
   – Chart’s 10th House = Stefan’s 1st House
   – Chart’s 11th House = Stefan’s 2nd House
   – Chart’s 12th House = Stefan’s 3rd House

5. Major Aspects (Exact aspects and orbs)
 • Mars Square Chiron (orb: 0°)
 • MC Opposition IC (orb: 0°)
 • Saturn Sextile MC (orb: 1°)
 • Pluto Square Ascendant (orb: 1°)
 • Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Venus Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Saturn Trine IC (orb: 1°)
 • Mercury Trine Jupiter (orb: 1°)
 • Venus Sextile Pluto (orb: 2°)
 • Venus Conjunction Neptune (orb: 2°)
 • Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 2°)
 • Pluto Sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Sun Sextile Chiron (orb: 3°)
 • Chiron Square IC (orb: 3°)
 • Chiron Square MC (orb: 3°)
 • Mars Opposition MC (orb: 3°)
 • Mars Conjunction IC (orb: 3°)
 • Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
 • Sun Conjunction Mercury (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus Sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 • Moon Square Pluto (orb: 5°)
 • Moon Square Mercury (orb: 5°)
 • Sun Trine Jupiter (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn Sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter Square Saturn (orb: 6°)
 • Moon Conjunction Ascendant (orb: 6°)
 • Sun Square Uranus (orb: 7°)
 • Uranus Trine MC (orb: 7°)

6. Pattern Formations
 • T-Square Formation:
  – Involving MC in 16° Capricorn, Chiron in 19° Aries, and IC in 16° Cancer, with Mars at 19° Cancer as a critical point.
 • Cradle Formation:
  – Involving Mars in 19° Cancer, MC in 16° Capricorn, Saturn in 17° Pisces, and Uranus in 23° Taurus.

7. Special Chart Features
 • Moon phase: Waxing crescent
 • Chart Shape: Bowl shape
 • Fixed mode dominates among the inner planets
 • Quadrant Distribution:
  – Bottom right quadrant: Empty
  – Top right quadrant: Empty
  – Most planets located in top left quadrant
  – Right hemisphere: Empty
 • Chiron is rising
 • Mars and the IC are positioned on the Nadir
 • Number of Square aspects: Eight occurrences (highest frequency among aspects)
 • Sun: In 12 aspects
 • Neptune in Pisces is in its rulership

These are the full details drawn from the horary chart that should be considered for analyzing the motivations behind Stefan’s actions with reference to his representation (the 9th house via the Chart’s 6th House) relative to Suzanne and the resulting wounding. Further interpretation can now be prepared based on this data.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the horary chart data, we see that several key factors point to a deeply personal conflict regarding Stefan’s decision and its continuing pain. The most significant indicators include:

1. Mars–Chiron Dynamics and the T-Square:
 • Mars in Cancer sits on the IC and forms a square with Chiron in Aries. This aspect points to impulsive actions that later wound the core of one’s personal self. In this case, Stefan’s act of adopting Suzanne’s identity (symbolically indicated by his position via the 9th house/6th house conversion) is driven by an impulse related to duty or a higher ideal, but it left an unresolved internal injury related to self-esteem and personal authenticity.
 • The T-square (MC in Capricorn, Chiron in Aries, and IC in Cancer with Mars as a pivot) underscores that the transformation he embraced while aligning with collective or idealistic standards conflicted deeply with his inner roots (IC) and his projected self (MC). This tension has reemerged as a source of ongoing emotional pain.

2. Saturn and Neptune Influences:
 • Saturn in Pisces (forming key sextiles to MC and trines to the IC) points to a longstanding karmic obligation or the weight of tradition. Stefan’s willingness to submit his individual identity may have been driven by an adherence to a spiritual or cultural ideal that, at the time, seemed necessary or fated, yet left him with a sense of limitation and regret.
 • Neptune’s conjunction with the North Node (and its inclusion in the 12th house cluster) hints at idealistic illusions—Stefan may have envisioned a transcendent identity merge that in reality undermined his personal boundaries, contributing later to a wounded sense of self.

3. House Conversions and Symbolism:
 • Represented by the 9th house (via his chart’s 6th house), Stefan’s role in this matter connects with foreign or transcendent ideals. The act of taking on Suzanne’s identity (a departure from his own traditional family or cultural markers) suggests a choice made under the influence of broader, possibly spiritual, ideals. Yet when the everyday reality of his personal needs (rooted in the IC and Mars’ placement) conflicts with these ideals, the result is a deep, persistent hurt.
 • The cross-reference indicates that while the initial decision was made in the realm of higher principles (9th house matters), the resulting emotional ramifications are felt on a very personal and domestic level (IC and 4th house matters in Stefan's converted chart).

4. Overall Synthesis:
 • Stefan’s voluntary submission of his personal identity appears to have been motivated by a desire to transcend conventional norms and align with a higher or more collective ideal intrinsic to his relationship with Suzanne. However, the harsh aspects involving Mars and Chiron reveal that this decision came at the expense of his inner emotional authenticity.
 • Over time, the sacrifice of his own identifying markers—originally intended as a unifying or noble act—has evolved into an ongoing wound. The clash between his higher ideals and deep-seated personal needs now creates a persistent sense of loss, regret, or diminished self-worth.

Based on these elements—the impulsive drive (Mars), the central wound (Chiron), the pressure of long-standing responsibilities and idealistic visions (Saturn and Neptune), and the symbolic shift represented by his house conversion—it appears that Stefan’s decision was both an act of transcending his own identity in favor of collective or spiritual ideals and a temporary solution to a deeper inner conflict. The price he now pays is the persistent pain of having not honored his authentic self, resulting in the emotional wounding you observe.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Madam, I just realized this chart, the ascendant, is at one degree. Does that mean that it's not a valid chart to be read?  Do I need to draw up a new one after meditating on the question again?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes: The ascendant's position at one degree does not invalidate the chart in any way. In horary practice, even an ascendant at one degree retains its full significance, its precise placement offering a distinct flavor to the reading. This degree can sometimes emphasize a sense of new beginnings or raw, unfiltered energies. There is no inherent need to redraw the chart after meditation, as the astrological dynamics remain intact and the chart continues to offer valid insights into your inquiry.
swipes: The ascendant's position at one degree does not invalidate the chart in any way. In horary practice, even an ascendant at one degree retains its full significance, its precise placement offering a distinct flavor to the reading. This degree can sometimes emphasize a sense of new beginnings or raw, unfiltered energies. There is no inherent need to redraw the chart after meditation, as the astrological dynamics remain intact and the chart continues to offer valid insights into your inquiry.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Does the chart tell specifically what this act was meant to be symbolic of? I did clarify specifics when I drew up the chart so it should have captured that, yes?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
The chart indicates that the act was meant to be a deliberate, symbolic surrender of Stefan’s established identity in favor of a higher, collective ideal. Specifically, his decision to adopt Suzanne's identity functioned as a ritual inversion of traditional personal markers—suggesting a metamorphosis aimed at aligning with transcendent, even foreign, energies represented by the 9th house. The dynamics of Mars square Chiron, with Mars placed on the IC and the T-square configuration, indicate that this surrender was not made lightly; it was an impulsive leap toward embodying a new, idealistic self rather than a mere concession, potentially reflecting a desire to break from conventional roles in favor of a higher calling.

Furthermore, Saturn in Pisces along with Neptune’s conjunction with the North Node reinforces that this act symbolized a commitment to an ideal or spiritual horizon—a union of identities that transcended the mundane. Stefan was engaging in a kind of symbolic ritual meant to dissolve his rigid individuality and embrace a union that, by its nature, was less about personal assertiveness and more about the collective, perhaps mystical, narrative he believed in at the time.

Thus, the chart captures that his sacrifice was less about renouncing his identity entirely and more about reconfiguring it in a context that prioritized an abstract, perhaps even esoteric, ideal over his personal, traditional sense of self.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: And what specifically is this having an effect on him now?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
The chart indicates that Stefan now bears the burden of an unresolved inner conflict. Specifically, the energies set in motion by his symbolic renunciation of his personal identity manifest as follows:

• A persistent inner wound, highlighted by the Mars–Chiron square, which suggests that the impulsive surrender he made continues to hurt at a very personal level. This manifests as a deep-seated self-alienation and a sense of emasculation or loss of authentic identity.

• Ongoing tension between his higher ideals (represented by the 9th house energies) and the practical, domestic imperatives of his real life (indicated by the IC position). The clash produces chronic emotional dissonance that may disturb his inner peace and family life.

• Saturn’s influence in Pisces, coupled with Neptune’s idealistic pull, intensifies feelings of regret and disillusionment. Stefan may feel that he committed to a role or ideal that never truly fit, resulting in ongoing emotional pain linked to a sense of betrayal—both of himself and possibly of the commitments he made.

• The T-square formation, with the pivot at Mars on the IC and involving Chiron and the MC, points to an experience where the sacrifice of his established identity continues to undermine his sense of security and public self. This misalignment could surface as recurring inner turmoil, self-doubt, and a challenging struggle to reconcile his personal needs with the lofty ideals he once aspired to.

Based on these factors, the act is having an effect on him now by keeping him trapped in a cycle of unresolved regret and inner conflict. The psychological aftershock disrupts his everyday life, making it difficult for him to engage fully as his authentic self—both in intimate relationships and in his broader personal identity.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Can you explain in more detail, please?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Stefan’s act—as symbolized in the chart—is an ongoing source of inner dissonance and emotional fragmentation. On a detailed level, the powerful Mars–Chiron square underlines that his concession was impulsive yet deeply injurious; Mars, operating as the force behind action and assertion, clashed with Chiron, the wounded healer symbolizing deep-seated vulnerabilities. In this configuration, the moment he relinquished aspects of his own identity in favor of a merged, idealized one, he inadvertently activated a profound self-injury—a wound that continues to affect him.

The T-square formation, with the pivot at Mars (located on his IC, which represents his innermost emotional home), deepens this dynamic by positioning his sacrifice in a sphere that governs his roots and private self. His drawing on higher, transcendent ideals (as denoted by his association with the 9th house) led him to forsake the secure, familiar aspects of who he truly is. The result is a tension between his idealized self-image and the raw, emotional requirements of his inner world.

Saturn’s influence in Pisces reinforces the notion of karmic obligation and the weight of tradition. In aligning himself with a tradition or ideal that he perceived as higher, Stefan may have suppressed not only his natural identity but also a part of his soul’s integrity. Meanwhile, Neptune’s placement and its conjunction with the North Node evoke a wistful, illusory pursuit of something more transcendent, one that promised liberation yet left behind misaligned expectations.

The interaction of these energies means that the act—which was symbolically intended to represent a union with an elevated ideal—has left him in a state of perpetual conflict. His public identity, intended to reflect this elevated union, is now at odds with his deeply personal sense of self, and the dissonance between these realms causes ongoing internal turmoil. The chart suggests that he grapples with self-alienation, where his sacrifice has created a gap between his authentic emotional needs and the higher ideals he felt compelled to uphold.

In practical terms, this disintegration manifests as unresolved grief, perhaps even bitterness, directed at what he sacrificed in the process: a coherent, whole identity. The very act that was meant to symbolize unity and the altruistic merging of identities now continues to impose a constant reminder of what he lost— his authentic self—resulting in enduring internal pain and persistent emotional wounds.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Chart Details: What specifically is the deeply personal reason(s) and motivation(s) that led Stefan to voluntarily submit his identity to Suzanne when he married her, and why is it wounding him now?
